author: Michael Larabel
description: Back during the Linux 6.18 merge window Linus Torvalds commented on "mindless and completely crazy Rust format checking" and that the RUst format checking "is all bass-ackwards garbage" with condensing multi-line import statements into single lines. Merged minutes ago to Linux Git ahead of tomorrow's Linux 6.18-rc2 are fixes to the Rust format checking and updated guidelines to address Torvalds' criticism...
title: New Code Merged For Linux 6.18 To Address Linus Torvalds' Rust Formatting Critique

author: Michael Larabel
description: Since Qualcomm announced the Snapdragon X2 Elite last month, Linux patches for the X2 Elite "Glymur" platform have begun flowing. Among the recent Linux patches for the Snapdragon X2 is this past week seeing initial display support...
title: Linux Display Driver Patches Posted For The Qualcomm Snapdragon X2 Elite

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those evaluating new options for high performance, cross-platform graphics and/or compute for simulations and other purposes, Tellusim Technologies has made their Tellusim Core SDK publicly available via GitHub...
title: Tellusim Core SDK Posted On GitHub As C++ SDK For Graphics / Compute

author: Michael Larabel
description: A few days back we reported on a Meta engineer uncovering an architectural issue with RDSEED usage on AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" CPUs. It ended up being found to affect more CPU models than originally anticipated and a new patch posted to the Linux kernel mailing list would disable RDSEED usage across all AMD Zen 5 processors...
title: Updated Linux Patch Would Disable RDSEED For All AMD Zen 5 CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Building off yesterday's release of Wine 10.17 is now wine-Staging 10.17 that is carrying 295 extra patches atop the upstream Wine codebase for testing at the leading edge of this open-source software for enjoying Windows games and applications on Linux...
title: Wine-Staging 10.17 Lands Fix For 11 Year Old Bug Report Affecting Various Games

author: Michael Larabel
description: LACT 0.8.2 is out this weekend as the newest feature release to this Linux GPU control application. This Rust-based software provides a GUI for controlling AMD, NVIDIA, and Intel GPUs under Linux with various monitoring metrics, information reporting, power configuration, thermals configuration, and overclocking with supported hardware...
title: LACT 0.8.2 Released For Multi-Vendor Linux GPU Control GUI

author: Michael Larabel
description: With plans to release next Tuesday (21 October), KDE developers this week have been putting the finishing touches on this next open-source desktop update. Prominent KDE developer Nate Graham says he thinks it's going to be "a pretty darn good release" when it officially debuts...
title: KDE Plasma 6.5 Is Said To Be "A Pretty Darn Good Release"
